clinical_study.brief_title: Seizures in Infants Hospitalized in Pediatric Intensive Care Unit for Bronchiolitis
clinical_study.official_title: Seizures in Infants Hospitalized in Pediatric Intensive Care Unit for Bronchiolitis : Description and Risk Factors

brief_summary.textblock: Bronchiolitis is the leading cause of pediatric intensive care unit admission in infants. Seizures during bronchiolitis may be a neurological complication of respiratory viruses but also of the treatments. The investigating team's hypothesis is that the incidence of seizures is not so so uncommon in infants hospitalized in the pediatric intensive care unit for severe bronchiolitis.

primary_outcome.measure: : Incidence of seizure during bronchiolitis (before or during hospitalization in the pediatric intensive care unit)
primary_outcome.description: Clinical or infra-clinical (diagnosed on Electroencephalography, EEG) seizure, simple or status epilepticus

arm_group.arm_group_label: Children admitted in the PICU for severe bronchiolitis
arm_group.description: Children admitted in the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) for severe bronchiolitis between January 1st, 2010 and April 30th, 2018

intervention.intervention_name: Incidence, management and risk factors of seizure
intervention.description: Incidence of seizure, management (treatment, paraclinical examinations) and risk factors of seizure in children admitted for severe bronchiolitis
intervention.arm_group_label: Children admitted in the PICU for severe bronchiolitis

study_pop.textblock: All children hospitalized in the pediatric intensive care unit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age < 90 days
- hospitalization from January 1st, 2010 to April 30th, 2018 in the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) of pediatric hospital in Lyon
- with bronchiolitis (clinical diagnosis according to American Academy of Pediatrics)
Exclusion Criteria:
- neurological history that may explain the occurrence of seizures
- significant congenital heart disease
